description: component results in the accumulation of PAXT substrates. Collectively, our results establish new factors involved in the turnover of nuclear pA+ RNA and suggest that these are limiting for PAXT activity.

keywords.name: submitter keyword
keywords.value: nuclear RNA exosome, RNA degradation, the PAXT connection, ZC3H3, RBM26, RBM27, PABPN1

terms.value: Silla T, Schmid M, Dou Y, Garland W, Milek M, Imami K, Johnsen D, Polak P, Andersen JS, Selbach M, Landthaler M, Jensen TH The human ZC3H3 and RBM26/27 proteins are critical for PAXT-mediated nuclear RNA decay. Nucleic Acids Res. 2020 Mar 18;48(5):2518-2530

title: An extended PAXT connection is required for turnover of nuclear polyadenylated RNA in human cells
